text: Tim Zuck is a Canadian painter of representational images. ==Life== Zuck was born 1947 in Erie, Pennsylvania, U.S. and has lived in Canada since 1969. He earned a BFA from the Nova Scotia College of Art and Design in 1971 and an MFA from the California Institute of the Arts in 1972. He has exhibited extensively in Canada since the 1970s, and has also shown in the United States and Japan. Zuck taught at the Alberta College of Art and Design from 2001 and was awarded Professor Emeritus status in 2015. ==Work== Tim Zuck’s work can be found in major public collections including: National Gallery of Canada; Art Gallery of Ontario; McMichael Canadian Art Collection; Vancouver Art Gallery; Winnipeg Art Gallery; Art Gallery of Nova Scotia and Canada Council Art Bank. He is represented by the Barbara Edwards Gallery in Toronto. Zuck's archives are held by the E.P.
